segment.source: How to Sequence a New Application
segment.target: How to Sequence a New Application

segment.source: How to Sequence a New Application
segment.target: How to Sequence a New Application

segment.source: How to Sequence a New Application
segment.target: How to Sequence a New Application

segment.source: The Application Virtualization (App-V) Sequencer creates applications that can be run in a virtual environment.
segment.target: The Application Virtualization (App-V) Sequencer creates applications that can be run in a virtual environment.

segment.source: The App-V Sequencer monitors the installation and setup process for an application, and it records the information necessary for the application to run in a virtual environment.
segment.target: The App-V Sequencer monitors the installation and setup process for an application, and it records the information necessary for the application to run in a virtual environment.

segment.source: You can also use the App-V Sequencer to configure which files and configurations are applicable to all users and which files and configurations users can customize.
segment.target: You can also use the App-V Sequencer to configure which files and configurations are applicable to all users and which files and configurations users can customize.

segment.source: When you sequence an application, you should save the package to a drive that is local to the computer you are sequencing on.
segment.target: When you sequence an application, you should save the package to a drive that is local to the computer you are sequencing on.

segment.source: A sequenced application does not interact with the operating system because each application runs in a virtual environment and is isolated from other applications that might be installed or running on the target computer.
segment.target: A sequenced application does not interact with the operating system because each application runs in a virtual environment and is isolated from other applications that might be installed or running on the target computer.

segment.source: This isolation dramatically reduces application conflicts and decreases the required amount of application pre-deployment testing.
segment.target: This isolation dramatically reduces application conflicts and decreases the required amount of application pre-deployment testing.

segment.source: After you successfully sequence the application, it is available in the App-V Sequencer Console.
segment.target: After you successfully sequence the application, it is available in the App-V Sequencer Console.

segment.source: Running the App-V sequencer in Safe Mode is not supported.
segment.target: Running the App-V sequencer in Safe Mode is not supported.

segment.source: To sequence a new application
segment.target: To sequence a new application

segment.source: You must create the Application Virtualization drive to sequence a new virtual application.
segment.target: You must create the Application Virtualization drive to sequence a new virtual application.

segment.source: To create the Application Virtualization drive, map the Q: drive to a location that can be used to save files while you are sequencing an application.
segment.target: To create the Application Virtualization drive, map the Q: drive to a location that can be used to save files while you are sequencing an application.

segment.source: You must then create individual directories for each application you plan to sequence on the Q: drive.
segment.target: You must then create individual directories for each application you plan to sequence on the Q: drive.

segment.source: You can create the virtual application target folders before you sequence an application, or you can create it in step 5 of this procedure.
segment.target: You can create the virtual application target folders before you sequence an application, or you can create it in step 5 of this procedure.

segment.source: To start the App-V Sequencer Console, on the computer that is running the App-V Sequencer, select StartProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.
segment.target: To start the App-V Sequencer Console, on the computer that is running the App-V Sequencer, select StartProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.

segment.source: To start the Sequencing Wizard, select FileNew Package.
segment.target: To start the Sequencing Wizard, select FileNew Package.

segment.source: On the Package Information page, specify the Package Name that will be assigned to the virtual application.
segment.target: On the Package Information page, specify the Package Name that will be assigned to the virtual application.

segment.source: The package name is required for generating the associated Windows Installer file.
segment.target: The package name is required for generating the associated Windows Installer file.

segment.source: You should also add an optional comment that will be assigned to the package and that provides detailed information about the virtual application.
segment.target: You should also add an optional comment that will be assigned to the package and that provides detailed information about the virtual application.

segment.source: To display the Advanced Options page, select Show Advanced Monitoring Options.
segment.target: To display the Advanced Options page, select Show Advanced Monitoring Options.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To display the Advanced Options page, you must select Show Advanced Monitoring Options.
segment.target: To display the Advanced Options page, you must select Show Advanced Monitoring Options.

segment.source: If you do not require the Advanced Options page, skip to step 4.
segment.target: If you do not require the Advanced Options page, skip to step 4.

segment.source: On the Advanced Options page, to specify the Block Size for the virtual application, select the size you want.
segment.target: On the Advanced Options page, to specify the Block Size for the virtual application, select the size you want.

segment.source: The block size determines how the .sft file will be divided for streaming the package across the network to target computers.
segment.target: The block size determines how the .sft file will be divided for streaming the package across the network to target computers.

segment.source: To allow Microsoft Update to update the application as it is being sequenced; select Allow Microsoft Update to run during monitoring.
segment.target: To allow Microsoft Update to update the application as it is being sequenced; select Allow Microsoft Update to run during monitoring.

segment.source: If you select this option, Microsoft Updates are allowed to be installed during the monitoring phase and you will need to accept the associated updates for them to be installed.
segment.target: If you select this option, Microsoft Updates are allowed to be installed during the monitoring phase and you will need to accept the associated updates for them to be installed.

segment.source: To remap the supported dynamic link library (.dll) files so that they use a contiguous space of RAM, select Rebase DLLs.
segment.target: To remap the supported dynamic link library (.dll) files so that they use a contiguous space of RAM, select Rebase DLLs.

segment.source: Selecting this option can conserve memory and help improve performance.
segment.target: Selecting this option can conserve memory and help improve performance.

segment.source: Many applications do not support this option, but it is useful in environments with limited RAM such as in Terminal Server scenarios.
segment.target: Many applications do not support this option, but it is useful in environments with limited RAM such as in Terminal Server scenarios.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Monitor Installation page, to monitor the installation of an application, click Begin Monitoring.
segment.target: On the Monitor Installation page, to monitor the installation of an application, click Begin Monitoring.

segment.source: After you click Begin Monitoring, specify the directory on the Q: drive where the application will be installed.
segment.target: After you click Begin Monitoring, specify the directory on the Q: drive where the application will be installed.

segment.source: To install the application to a folder that has not been ccreated, click Make New Folder.
segment.target: To install the application to a folder that has not been ccreated, click Make New Folder.

segment.source: You must install each application that you sequence into a separate directory.
segment.target: You must install each application that you sequence into a separate directory.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The folder name you specify must not be longer than 8 characters.
segment.target: The folder name you specify must not be longer than 8 characters.

segment.source: Wait for the virtual environment to load, and then install the application so that the App-V Sequencer can monitor the process.
segment.target: Wait for the virtual environment to load, and then install the application so that the App-V Sequencer can monitor the process.

segment.source: When you have completed the installation, click Stop Monitoring and then click Next.
segment.target: When you have completed the installation, click Stop Monitoring and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Additional Files to Map to Virtual File System (VFS) page, to specify additional files to be added to the Virtual File System (VFS), click Add.
segment.target: On the Additional Files to Map to Virtual File System (VFS) page, to specify additional files to be added to the Virtual File System (VFS), click Add.

segment.source: Browse to the file you want to add, and click Open.
segment.target: Browse to the file you want to add, and click Open.

segment.source: To clear existing files that have been added, click Reset and then click Next.
segment.target: To clear existing files that have been added, click Reset and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Configure Applications page, configure the shortcuts and file type associations that will be associated with the virtual application.
segment.target: On the Configure Applications page, configure the shortcuts and file type associations that will be associated with the virtual application.

segment.source: Select the element you want to update, and then click Edit Locations.
segment.target: Select the element you want to update, and then click Edit Locations.

segment.source: Specify the configurations in the Shortcut Locations dialog box.
segment.target: Specify the configurations in the Shortcut Locations dialog box.

segment.source: Click OK and then click Next.
segment.target: Click OK and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Launch Applications page, to start the application to ensure that the package is optimized for streaming, select the package and click Launch.
segment.target: On the Launch Applications page, to start the application to ensure that the package is optimized for streaming, select the package and click Launch.

segment.source: This step is useful for configuring how the application initially runs on target computers and for accepting any associated license agreements before the package is made available to clients.
segment.target: This step is useful for configuring how the application initially runs on target computers and for accepting any associated license agreements before the package is made available to clients.

segment.source: If there are multiple applications associated with this package, you can select Launch All to open all of the applications.
segment.target: If there are multiple applications associated with this package, you can select Launch All to open all of the applications.

segment.source: To sequence the package, click Next.
segment.target: To sequence the package, click Next.

segment.source: On the Sequence Package page, to close the wizard, click Finish.
segment.target: On the Sequence Package page, to close the wizard, click Finish.

segment.source: After you have successfully created the package, to save the package, in the App-V Sequencer Console, select FileSave and specify the name and the location where the package will be saved.
segment.target: After you have successfully created the package, to save the package, in the App-V Sequencer Console, select FileSave and specify the name and the location where the package will be saved.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: Tasks for the Application Virtualization Sequencer
segment.target: Tasks for the Application Virtualization Sequencer
